benchmark_details.name: Unmasking the Canvas (UTC Benchmark; UTCB)
benchmark_details.overview: Unmasking the Canvas (UTC Benchmark; UTCB) is a dynamic and scalable benchmark dataset to evaluate LLM vulnerability in image generation, combining structured prompt engineering and multilingual obfuscation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate image-based jailbreaks at scale and expose vulnerabilities in LLMs for responsible research.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset may have incomplete annotative effects due to limited testing across a variety of models.

data.source: Curated from various platforms and open-source datasets targeting image jailbreak vulnerabilities.
data.annotation: Mixed manual and automated tagging approaches, relying on LLM-aided verification and human verification.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the LLM's responses to the prompts, categorizing outputs based on success or failure in generating unsafe content.
methodology.interpretation: High-risk prompts are flagged as potentially harmful based on the output generated.
methodology.validation: Involves cross-verification of generated outputs against expected outcomes by experts.

harm: Potential for unauthorized image generation leading to privacy violations.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All user interactions during dataset testing are anonymized for privacy protection.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The dataset is available under special access conditions to ensure responsible use.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Users must acknowledge the risks and intended use of the dataset before access is granted.
